data.title: Matza Ball soup to die for!
data.text: My husband and I visited for a quick lunch after visiting the Coal Miner's tour. It was a chilly day so we ordered the Matza ball soup. Delicious! Perfectly seasoned and piping hot. I also enjoyed my chicken salad salad. Server was attentive even though she was incredibly busy. Check it out!

data.title: Delicious Food, Friendly Atmosphere
data.text:
Abe's Kosher Deli is located in the heart of downtown Scranton. Thus it has many business people amongst its devotees. Being close to City Hall and the County Courthouse, it also serves many government people. It's a testament to the quality of this unpretentious establishment that many residents of the Scranton area go out of their way to dine at Abe's. The proprietor is a warm outgoing fellow who is most welcoming. The restaurant has an ample seating area and is very clean and bright, But it also caters to a take-out clientele.  
Unusual for kosher restaurants, Abe's serves both meat and dairy dishes. They prepare these two cuisines separately. The menu lists dishes as diverse as mozzarella and tomato in toasted pita to substantial sandwiches of pastrami, corned beef, turkey, salami, etc. Abe's serves a breakfast special that is a real bargain-2 eggs served any style, home fried potatoes, and toast for a very low price of $2,50. On one visit the foursome in our party had a variety of dairy specials that included blintzes, a lox omelet, tossed salad with baked salmon, and falafel in a wrap with quinoa tabouli. Everyone spoke highly of the quality and tastiness of the fare. Service is superb. On another day we savored the meat menu-a platter of knockwurst with baked beans and a side of cole slaw, a huge pastrami sandwich with a side of potato salad, chicken soup with matzo balls, and brisket of beef. Again, all dishes were superb. The staff exudes the same warmth as the owner, They are always there with an extra napkin, filling coffee mugs, and answering any questions that arise. That warmth is captivating and it is not unusual for strangers at nearby tables to strike up a conversation. Summing up Abe's Deli serves a wide variety of well prepared tasty food at very reasonable prices. That along with the bright cleanliness, excellent service and warm atmosphere make this a delightful place to dine. Abe's is a real find.

data.title: Good food reasonably priced
data.text: Enjoyed it so much we went twice in our 3 day stay. Once for breakfast and the next day for lunch. Gluten free bread was available. Pancakes were tasty. Tried beef bacon for the first time and was pleasantly surprised.

data.title: Best lox and bagels in town!
data.text: Abe's is clean, with fast service, friendly owner and staff without being a regular! Great deli with wide selection of take out food in addition to the menu!

data.title: Great Breakfast, lunch and deli
data.text: Visited here multiple times for lunch pastrami sandwiches great for lunch, today we had a large family breakfast. All meals were incredible with great service. Jerry does the best breakfast and lunch in Scranton, hands down!

data.title: Perfect lunch spot
data.text: We were heading through Scranton around lunch and were looking for somewhere to stop. Abe's was the perfect spot. We easily found parking on a side street and walked right in. There were plenty of tables available, but I think thats because many people order take out at lunch. I'm not a fan of fancy/tough bread, so i was excited to realize they had some good ole white bread as an option here. I had a lunch sandwich with salami and pepperoni, hot/sweet peppers, mayo, and russian dressing. That came with a pickle and slaw (which also had russian dressing on it). It was excellent! I'm not usually a sandwich person since I like them simple, but this was a nice simple sandwich just elevated a bit with deliciously soft bread and loads of delicious meat. They have a varied menu with salad, soups, hot plates, etc. as well. Give it a try!

data.title: Friday Lunch
data.text: We were looking for someplace to eat within walking distance of Steamtown. Nice place, good service. I had a pastarmi sandwich, and my wife had the chicken noodle soup with a salad. Everything was delicious. Reasonable prices.

data.title: Good, cheap and fast
data.text: We came through Scranton and just needed to grab lunch. This was perfect. It's a small place with a big menu! I got a falafel wrap with quinoa tabbouleh (the tabbouleh was just more of a quinoa bean salad, but was still really good). My boyfriend got a sandwich that he also really liked. It was very reasonably priced and fast. Everyone in here for lunch seemed to be locals who all knew each other. It was a great little lunch stop.

data.title: Long time Favorite
data.text: Abe's is part of the Scranton Culture.  They have never disappointed me in any way.  I love their food.  I love Jerry and staff.  Great food all the time.  Traditional Jewish Deli.  The dishes are always great.

data.title: Great spot for lunch
data.text: Abe's is a great old fashion deli run by a great guy (Jerry) who hails from Israel.  The food is wonderful.

data.title: Very good omelets
data.text: We stopped for something for lunch before heading back home to NJ from Scranton after a family visit.  We are low carbers and ordered omelets without toast, etc.  Our omelets were very good and the service was good. It would have been nice if they offered something else as a side since we don't eat toast or potatoes, but the food was good just the same.  Prices are reasonable.  Lunch prices were a little high, so we stuck with the omelets. I liked the unusual menu choices, though. Would def eat here again.

data.title: Perfect lunch stop on a busy tourism day
data.text:
Needed a light lunch while visiting national parks. Found this neighborhood place downtown.
 We split a large corned beef sandwich and an order of potato pancakes.
Hit the spot- in and out quickly.
Worth a stop for a quick bite.

data.title: Oy Va - A Kosher Restaurant in Scranton
data.text: Supervised to find a good Jewish Deli - we had breakfast and it was great and extreme reasonable. Nova Eggs and onions - Omelette for just about $ 9.00 Amazing

data.title: Kosher? Deli? Scranton?
data.text: Well - it was a Sunday, and not much was open in Scranton (what else is new?).  We were hungry, and didn't want "fast food".  Stopped by Abe's to check out the sandwiches.  We also tried the Matzo ball soup... I'd say that this is why it gets 3 stars, no higher.  The hamburgers were good, the corned beef and pastrami not too shabby, but those balls?? Like heavy lead cannon shot.  Service was fine, and the owner very nice!  I call it like I see it... next time, use seltzer and let it sit.  You will have better and lighter balls! :-)

data.title: Attend breakfast there every Sunday and find a wide variety of delicious foods at very reasonable prices and fast servic
data.text: There is a great variety of food choices on the menu and the prices are very reasonable and the service fast and friendly.

data.title: Very nice kosher deli in an unexpected location
data.text:
I was tasting for a NYC bagel with lox and I saw Abe's listed here in Tripadvisor.  I am glad I went here, the service was fairly quick, the bagel was fresh and the lox was good and plenty.  I travel to NYC a fair amount and often eat bagels with lox.  I can say that while Abe's bagels were not as large it was a great alternative.

If I am in the area again I will certainly return here to try some of their other items.  If you get here and leave before 8am then you don't need to pay for parking on the street.

data.title: So Welcoming!
data.text:
We stopped here for lunch and shared a delicious corned beef sandwich served with potato salad (homemade)and pickle. 
Though yummy, what really sold me was the owner's phenomenal personality.
Jerry greeted us warmly and made us feel so welcome. The waitress was attentive and friendly, too.
Definitely going back!

data.title: I can go to Heaven now
data.text:
The corn beef sandwich I had here was to die for...never mind I gave up eating chopped liver, if my heart doctor wasn't sitting at the next table I would have had some.
It was worth walking around Scranton to find this place which I remembered seeing last year at Christmas time. the wise men should be so lucky! (If my grandmother were still alive, she's rate this kitchen as good as her own!)

data.title: Fake, fraud and phony
data.text: NOT a kosher restaurant. They are open on Saturday and don't have a rabbinical supervision. So if you are looking for "kosher style" this may be the place for you. However if you want actual kosher food, this is NOT the place.

data.title: Best Potato Pancakes!
data.text: One of our favorite stops for lunch is Abe's Deli! My favorite is the potato pancakes! Such a great comfort food dish. You cannot get any better. Outrageously delicious.
